page.title: 04'City of Cardiff', Nanjizel.
page.content: In 1912 the steamer 'City of Cardiff' lost her rudder in a storm whilst rounding Land's End. She drifted onto the sandbar in Nanjizel and eventually against the cliffs at the north end of the bay.{The crew were rescued by {rocket life-saving apparatus and a {breeches buoy.}Eventually much of the ship was broken up and taken away using steam wagons. Evidence of where the blocks and tackle were anchored can still be seen in the cliff side along the present coastal footpath. At spring low tide,{two boilers of the {ship were visible until recently,}but now only one can still be seen.{(photo {C).}It is thought a salvage vessel working on another wreck, possibly the steamer 'Balbec', wrecked one hundred years ago in 1884, which became visible on the bar in 1984, may have disturbed the other boiler.
